page.title: 11GYFYLCHI MOUNTAIN CENTRE
page.content: Just across the Pelenna River, outside the village is the site of a ruined chapel - Gyfylchi Chapel. Using stone from the row of disused colliers' cottages that the chapel served, the Neath Development Partnership - a Neath Borough Council enterprise to develop employment in the Neath area - has built a Mountain Centre. It has accomodation for groups who wish to come and use the numerous sports and outdoor pursuits amenities in South West Wales. The centre is very much the product of a local borough councillor called Howell Britton but the actual building was carried out by long-term unemployed people from the Neath area, including people from Tonmawr.A great deal of retraining was involved ... a young woman learned plastering, for example.
